title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. stocks soared, with technology shares leading the way. The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow advanced 3.1%, 2.5% and 1.8%, respectively.

Labor Department officials believe Fidelity's plan to allow investors to put bitcoin in their 401(k) accounts risks the retirement security of Americans, a senior administrator said.

Twitter said its revenue and number of users rose in the first quarter, as the company prepares to be acquired by Musk and go private.

Intel's Gelsinger said the chip shortage will last longer than expected, as the semiconductor giant reported a decrease in quarterly sales.

Comcast said the number of paying subscribers to its Peacock streaming service jumped by more than 40% in the first quarter.

Robinhood's revenue fell 43%, the fifth consecutive decline in quarterly sales.

What's News: Business & Finance
